questions.question_text: A client is upgrading its wireless infrastructure to IEEE 802.11n-capable access points. Which technology leverages the 802.11n radios to provide better coverage and throughput for legacy IEEE 802.11a/g clients?

discussion.content:
MIMO is definitely wrong. I guess beamforming is correct
https://www.networkworld.com/article/2272301/cisco-s-new-11n-gear-boosts-legacy-wi-fi-performance-with-beamforming.html

questions.question_text: A customer has a deployment of Cisco Identity Services Engine, Cisco 5508 Wireless Controllers, and Cisco Prime Infrastructure. When you troubleshoot client connectivity, which two management interface GUIs provide real-time information on client association? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
It is C and D:
"Monitoringâ€”Provides a real-time presentation of meaningful data representing the state of access activities on a network. This insight allows you to easily interpret and effect operational conditions. "
(https://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/ise/1.0/user_guide/ise10_mnt.html)
D is incorrect as the SSID would still be advertised if it was the wrong interface. If the client could connect but not obtain an IP address D could be correct
Couldn't D be the correct answer here?

choices.D: The WLAN is mapped to an incorrect interface or interface group
choices.C: The WLAN controller needs a restart for the new configuration to take effect
choices.B: The WLAN has the wrong NAS ID

questions.question_text: You have created a new WLAN. However, no clients can connect and the SSID does not appear on the available wireless networks. Which cause of the issue is true?

discussion.content:
The correct answers are CE.
The question specify that you need roaming between Cisco Catlayst 3650 Server Switches so you need a switch peer group that contain them. If you select only a mobility agent then the roaming is performed only betwen APs conected to MA.

I guess they are assuming a Switch Peer Group(group of MA's)
 already contains all the MA's needed so you can just list that an a MC.

comments.content: You don't REQUIRE a "SWitched Peer Group for roaming, but it makes transition quicker. You do require Mobility controllers and Agents though. Any thoughts as to why the answer doen't include Mobility Controller?

questions.question_text:
When configuring roaming in a converged wireless infrastrucutre, which two confgiurations are necessary to roam between Cisco Catlayst 3650 Server Switches?
(Choose two.)

discussion.content: Correct answer is A, C, F
